credentials: PHD 1967 Univ of California San Diego
name: M THOMAS RECORD

ratings.comment: Chem565 was by far the hardest class I took at UW-Madison. That being said - Professor Record did everything in his power to make sure his students understood the material and were prepared for the exam. Office hours were not mandatory, but ESSENTIAL if you want to complete the homework and understand the material. ALWAYS ASK FOR HELP!

Going to office hours and staying on top of problem sets was essential. Many exam questions are modeled off of these problem sets, so do them and memorize how to do them. We didn't use a textbook, but we got a series of handouts. Give these a good skim at least. He was very enthusiastic about teaching and made himself accessible- very refreshing!

Professor Record is an overall excellent teacher stuck with one of the hardest classes I've taken. The course material is very tough and math heavy, so it's important to know your calculus beforehand to do well. COVID was a difficult adjusting period, and Record definitely tried his best to help our class through.

I really liked taking this class online during covid times. Tom and the TAs were so accomidating with covid going on and having the lectures recorded/handwritten notes by the professor in the lecture was really easy for me to follow compared to difficult classes that had lecture slides. Definitely takes a lot of time to do anything in this class
He really cares about student success. The hardest class I've taken at UW Madison, but no fault of Tom Record. If he and the TAs know that you are trying, you will not fail.
Difficult subject material, however help is always accessible

Probably one of the best professors I've had. He absolutely LOVES the material he teaches and is always willing to answer any question. The material is extremely hard, but his problem sets are very helpful for the exams so make sure you do them every week.

This is a very difficult class. The textbook isn't the most clear to follow, but it is helpful in doing the problem sets. While the organization of Professor Record's lecture isn't always the best, it is obvious that he's a good guy and cares about his students. He always welcomes questions and makes an effort to know students' names.

Homework and exams are full of typos. His handwriting is sometimes illegible, and he frequently makes mistakes during lecture. He definitely perpetuates the notion of pchem being a horrendously boring, difficult subject. Fortunately, the exams are heavily curved such that 40% of the class will get A's.
Terribly organized lecturer, horribly written textbook. TAs are your only hope in this class. The tests are graded off an amazing curve though
no... just.... no
skip this class and take it in the spring he has very bad lecturing skills... does not teach...exams are crazy.

Easily the worst class I've had. Record is arrogant and a horrible teacher. Don't even bother asking him questions because you won't get a useful answer. My advice to people taking this class: switch to the spring semester without Record. If not, clear your schedule because you'll be going to TA office hours a lot
Its basically thermodynamics and kinetics, not much biochemistry. Easy for people with good maths.

Smartest P chemist teaching most boring chem subject about thermodynamics and kinetics. if you understand glycine betaine and hemoglobin (his favorites) COMPLETELY (which you will not!), an A will be a breeze!

Teaches from his own notes, from which he likely plans to write his own textbook... eventually. In the mean time, they lack the finish of a published text, but do follow class material quite well. Good sense of humor, modest, sharp and enthusiastic. If Ben Knowles TAs, try for his section. Not terribly difficult, but do work problems.

For as boring a topic as he teaches, Professor Record has a great enthusiasm for the topic and for helping his students.  The material is hard, and the text is awkward to use, but at least it's relevant to the situations covered in this class unlike a pchem text.  Expect to work hard in his class, but he tries to give you the tools to do well.

Really bad.  His "textbook" is difficult to navigate through.  There's no index.  He goes through so much math and dozens of Ks to describe a very small number of physcal situations.  Not a fun class at all.

I don't like this class. The handouts don't have adequate explanations. Also, in class it seems like he does not explain how do use things appropriately, he just writes equations on the board. He does not really explain how to solve problems. I wish he just used a normal text.

This class isn't as bad as people make it out to be.  If you do all your homework and go to office hours, you'll get a decent grade.  Don't be afraid to ask Tom questions, he's a nice guy and loves questions.  After you take an exam, you'll think you failed.  You didn't.
how can you not like prof record?  he is one of the nicest, most approachable profs at uw.  obviously the class is hard and he knows this.  as long as you show effort he'll be lenient

This class is hard, very hard, but the TA's and especially the professor really try to help. I highly recommend going to office hours as doing ALL the prolem sets, it will be to your great advantage in the end, Record notices those who put in effort. Basically if you put in the work, you'll be rewarded!

This class is extremely difficult, but professor Record is probably the best person to teach it. He tries to make things as simple as they can be, without compromising challenges. He is very approachable and definitely makes an effort to help students and answer questions. Others probably didn't find it helpful if they didn't do the hw or ask quest

I am surprised at the other comments listed. This class is not easy, but he is very willing to help and strongly encourages questions. If you do the weekly problem sets, and show effort, you are compensated and your score on the problem sets can take the place of 25% of each exam. Record cares about you doing well, and will make the time to help.
He did not over any help when I needed it instead he told me to drop the class.

A complete waste of time.  His lectures are difficult to follow, and the reading material doesn't support the lectures, or give any help.  He's unresponsive to questions.  You might as well buy a book and teach yourself.  Worthless.

Don't be fooled if you hear someone tell you that he is a good teacher!  His class was a complete waste of time, and I only did OK in it because I learned some of the course material elsewhere.  He would make an excellent bureaucrat, but is a poor teacher
